00012 template <class T> class Prop {
00013  public:
00014   T* operator ->() { return &_value; }
00015   &operator T() { return _value; }
00016   T& operator =( T value ) { _value = value; cout << "operator=()\n" << endl; }
00017   T _value;
00018 };

00020 template<class T> class Primitive {
00021  public:
00022   Primitive<T>( T value ) : _value( value ) { }
00023   Primitive<T>() : _value( 0 ) { }
00024   T& operator =( T value ) { _value = value; return _value; }
00025   operator T&() { return _value; }
00026   bool operator >( T value ) { return value > _value; }
00027   //T operator ++( int value ) { _value++; }
00028   //T operator +=( Primitive<T>& value ) { _value += value; }
00029 
00030  private:
00031   T     _value;
00032 };

00041 // class Ptr
00042 /*
00043    @brief Smart pointer
00044 */
00045 
00046 template<class T> class Ptr {
00047  public:
00048  // Constructors
00049     Ptr<T>() { _object = 0; }
00050     Ptr<T>( T& object ) { _object = &object; }
00051     //Ptr<T>( T* object ) { _object = object; }
00052     //Ptr<T>( Ptr<T>& object ) { _object = &object; }
00053 
00054     T& operator =( T& object ) { _object = &object; return *_object; }
00055     operator bool() { return _object != 0; }
00056  // Operator ->
00057     T* operator ->() {
00058       if( _object == 0 ) {
00059         cout << "null pointer" << endl;
00060         throw string("error");
00061       }
00062       return _object;
00063     }
00064  // Used for inheritance issue
00065     template <class U> Ptr( const Ptr<U>& object ) {
00066       _object = object._object;
00067     }
00068  // Return the actual pointer
00069     T* ptr() { return _object; }
00070 
00071  //private:
00072   T *_object;
00073 //  T  _class;
00074 };
